conclusion: Two identical books A and B each weigh 5N.
The books are divided into several equal parts and alternately stacked.
A horizontal force F is applied to pull out book B from book A.
The force F required to slide book B out for different numbers of trials and book divisions is given.
The frictional force f between any two sheets is given by f = μN, where N is the normal force (pressure).
The normal force N is the weight of the books in contact. Since each book weighs 5N, the normal force for each division is the combined weight of the sections in contact.
For each trial, the force F is equal to the frictional force required to slide the book.
The frictional force f = μ × N.
For trial 1, N is the weight of half of book B that is in contact, which is 2.5N.
The coefficient of kinetic friction μ between the sheets of paper is 1.8.
